application_type_full: Approval of details reserved by a condition (discharge)
description:
Application under Section 73 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) for a variation of Condition 2 (approved drawings); Condition 57 (Dwellings number) and 58 (Commercial Floorspace) of planning permission 00616/F/P21 to substitute the approved drawings to allow a decrease in the retail A1-A5 floor area from 11,199 sqm to 8,897 sqm (Gross External Area), introduction of 1,214 sqm (Gross External Area) B1(a) office floor space to replace retail mezzanine in units 3, 4 and 5 (Block E), 60 additional homes (11 homes through conversion of retail mezzanines in units 10 and 11 in Blocks B and C; 49 homes within
additional storeys above Blocks A, B [except Tower] and C) to increase total number of residential homes to 588, and alterations to the fenestration, elevational detailing, massing, amenity space and cycle parking provision for development comprising: 
Demolition of commercial and residential properties, site  clearance and redevelopment comprising the construction of a mixed-use development comprising private and affordable residential units, a multiscreen cinema, commercial floorspace, infrastructure including parking spaces, cycle parking spaces, service areas,
public realm incorporating pedestrian/cycle circulation areas with associated hard and soft landscaping and private amenity spaces.
site_name: Land On The South Side Of
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The Development hereby approved, shall be begun no later than the expiration of five years from 08 February 2016.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (see attached schedule) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 3 - The phasing of the development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved phasing plan, Barratt London - Planning Condition 3 (Phasing Plan) Discharge Revision 01 April 2017; E1108-E-0-220-P2 Phase 1 & 2 (plan 1) Enabling Works & Demolition; E1108-E-3-099-P9 Phase 2 & 4 (plan 2) Basement Construction Level B1; E1108-E-3-098-P3 Phase 2 & 4 (plan 3) Basement Construction Level B2; E1108-E-3-100-P11 Phase 3 - 6 (plan 4) Ground Floor Construction - Received: 19/04/2017 and approved under application 00616/F/P20(3), unless an alternative phasing plan is first submitted to the Local Planning Authority with an assessment of any effects of the alterations, including any different impacts on the environment, and that alternative plan and assessment is approved by the Local Planning Authority pursuant to this condition.

Condition : 4 - The development shall be carried out in accordance in all respects with Barratt London - Planning Condition 4 (Construction Management Plan - CMP) Discharge Revision 02 November 2017; Hounslow CMP 16 11 17 REV 09 Final; HHQ-Construction Programme -27 [25.09.2017] Detailed; HHQ-Construction Programme -27 [25.09.2017] Summary; Construction Traffic Routes V2.0; Construction Logistics Technical Note V2.0; Construction Logistics 2nd Technical Note V3.0. Received: 16/11/2017 as approved under application 00616/F/P20(4). Any variation the approved details shall be agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 5 - The development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with Barratt London - Planning Condition 5 (Construction Travel Plan) Discharge Revision 01 April 2017. Received: 12/04/2017 Construction Workers Travel Plan by Stillwell, 10 April 2017 Received: 30/05/2017, approved under application 00616/F/P20(5)

Condition : 6 - The development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with Barratt London Planning Condition 6 (Surface Water Drainage Scheme) Discharge, Revision 01 - April 2017; Below Ground Drainage (5089-1-GA-440-0001 & 5089-1-GA-440-002); L15089-DS-SuDs (Drainage strategy & SuDS Report); L15089-MMP (Maintenance and Management Plan); L15089-MD-NTW1, NTW2, NTW3 (MicroDrainage Calculation); L15089-TWSWA (Thames Water Surface Water Flow Approval); L15089-106R (Thames Water 106 response). Received: 19/04/2017 Barratt London Timetable of Implementation for Drainage and SuDS. Received: 26/05/2017 Email from Dan Carter (TP Bennett) to Sam Smith (LB Hounslow) on 19/06/2017 at 12:41 - subject: Hounslow HSQ - Condition 6. Received: 19/06/2017, approved under application 00616/F/P20(6).

Condition : 7 - A)	The development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with Barratt London - Planning Condition 7A (BREEAM) Discharge Revision 01 JULY 2017 and AECOM JW/MD 31.05.17 Planning Condition received 17/07/2017.
(B)	The development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with Barratt London - Planning Condition 7B Discharge Revision 01 June 2018 Interim Certificate - Cinema dated: 12/04/2018 Interim Certificate - Unit 10 dated: 18/05/2018 Interim Certificate - Unit 11 dated: 23/04/2018 Received: 26/06/2018, as approved under 00616/F/P21(7B).
(C)	Within 6 months of first occupation of the relevant building, a BREEAM UK New Construction 2011 (or such equivalent standard that replaces this) Final (Post-Construction) Certificate, issued by the BRE, demonstrating that an 'Excellent' rating, has been achieved, must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 8 - (A) No development shall take place on any phase excluding Phases 1 and 2, which shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with Barratt London - Planning Condition 8A (Sustainable Drainage) Discharge Revision A May 2017; Concrete slabs Green Guide rating; Blockwork Green Guide rating; BREEAM Mat 3 Responsible Sourcing of Materials letter; E1108 L0398A Basement Level 2 Internal Walls, Wall type identification plan; E1108 L0399A Basement Level 1 Internal Walls, Wall type identification plan. Received: 05/05/2017 and approved under application 00616/F/P20(8A), until details for that phase have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority demonstrating that: -
i.	 At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) are to achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) Green Guide to Specification; 
ii.	 At least 50% of timber and timber products are to be sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme; and 
iii.	 No construction or insulation materials are to be used which will release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.
(B) The building in that phase shall not be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of installation contracts) has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development of that building has been carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 9 - (A) The development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with Barratt London - Planning Condition 9(A) (Waste) Discharge Revision 01 June 2017; Condition 9A Appendix 1 - email exchange with Jessica Sheen of LBH (March 2016); Condition 9A Appendix 2 - email exchange with Pezhman Goudarzi of LBH (May 2017); Condition 9A Appendix 3 - Refuse Strategy Package - TPBennett;  E1108 V 0 298 P2 E1108 V 0 300 A - Received: 12/06/2017.

(B) No phase of the development shall be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of installation contracts), demonstrating that the development of that phase has been carried out in accordance with the approved details, has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 10 - The development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with Barratt London - Planning Condition 10 (Bird Hazard Management Plan) Discharge Revision 01 April 2017; Ecological Management Plan, February 2017 by Greengage Environmental Ltd. Received: 12/04/2017, as approved under application 00616/F/P20(10).

Condition : 11 - No phase of the development shall be occupied until the disabled access for that phase has been installed in accordance with the approved details, Barratt London - Planning Condition 11 (Disabled Access Strategy) Discharge Revision 01 May 2017; Disabled Access Strategy package; E1108 V0198P1 - Access Strategy B2 level; E1108 V0199P1 - Access Strategy B1 level Basement; E1108 V0200P1 - Access Strategy Ground Floor; E1108 V0103P1 - Access Strategy Residential Level 3 (Tower level 1) - Received: 12/06/2017.

Condition : 12 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the Phase One Desk Study Deport (ref. 72451) dated June 2013 by Mayer Environmental and the Environmental and Geotechnical Phase II Assessment (Ref 47072099/LORP0001 Final) dated 9 January 2015 by URS.  During the course of the development: The Local Planning Authority shall be notified immediately if additional contamination is discovered during the course of the development. A competent person shall assess the additional contamination and shall submit appropriate amendments to the scheme for decontamination in writing to the Local Planning Authority for approval before any work on that aspect of development continues.  Before the development of any phase is first brought into use: The agreed scheme for decontamination for that phase shall be fully implemented and a written validation (closure) report submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 13 - The development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with Barratt London - Planning Condition 13 (Stage 1 WSI) Discharge Revision 01 April 2017;  Written Scheme of Investigation for an Archaeological Evaluation dated 17/03/2017; Email from Laura O'Gorman (Historic England) to Harry Clarke (MOLA) dated 30/03/2017. Received: 19/04/2017, approved under application 00616/F/P20(13).
If heritage assets of archaeological interest are identified through the Stage 1 WSI, then no demolition or development shall take place for those parts of the site which have archaeological interest until a Stage 2 WSI is submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The demolition and/or development on land included within the Stage 2 WSI must then be carried out in accordance with the approved Stage 2 WSI, which shall include: 
A.	The statement of significance and research objectives, the programme and methodology of site investigation and recording and the nomination of a competent person(s) or organisation to undertake the agreed works. 
B.	The programme for post-investigation assessment and subsequent analysis, publication and dissemination and deposition of resulting material.

Condition : 15 - No phase of the development shall be occuped until the scheme of acoustic insulation and any other necessary means of ventilation provided for that phase have been implemented in accordance with the approved details, Barratt London - Planning Condition 15 Discharge Revision 01 April 2017; 4970-B-GA-250-0008 T2 MVHR - Lo-Carbon Sentinel KineticTC-1157-EL01-PH01 Rev E. Received: 26/04/2017. 01-16-55724 NC12 Rev D - Hounslow HSQ -Discharge of Planning Conditions 15 & 21A Received: 02/10/2017, as approved under application 00616/F/P20(15).

Condition : 16 - Each phase of the development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details, Barratt London - Planning Condition 16 (Secured by Design) Discharge Revision 01 June 2017; E1108D0100P21 - Ground Level; E1108D0099P12 - Basement Level 1;  E1108D0098P10 - Basement Level 2;  E1108D0101P11 - Level 1 / Mezzanine level; 4970-1-XX-260-001, Rev T1 Legends Sheet;  4970-1-GA-262-003, Rev T1 Basement 1 Small Power & Ancillary Service Layout (Sheet 1 of 4); 4970-1-GA-262-004, Rev T1 Basement 1 Small Power & Ancillary Service Layout (Sheet 2 of 4);  4970-1-GA-262-005, Rev T1 Basement 1 Small Power & Ancillary Service Layout (Sheet 3 of 4);  4970-1-GA-262-006, Rev T1 Basement 1 Small Power & Ancillary Service Layout (Sheet4 of 4);  4970-1-GA-262-007, Rev T1 Ground Floor Small Power & Ancillary Service Layout (Sheet 1 of 5);  4970-1-GA-262-008, Rev T1 Ground Floor Small Power & Ancillary Service Layout (Sheet 2 of 5);  4970-1-GA-262-009, Rev T1 Ground Floor Small Power & Ancillary Service Layout (Sheet 3 of 5);  4970-1-GA-262-010, Rev T1 Ground Floor Small Power & Ancillary Service Layout (Sheet 4 of 5);  4970-1-GA-262-011, Rev T1 Ground Floor Small Power & Ancillary Service Layout (Sheet 5 of 5);  4970-1-GA-262-020, Rev T1 Basement 2 Small Power & Ancillary Service Layout (Sheet 1 of 4);  4970-1-GA-262-021, Rev T1 Basement 2 Small Power & Ancillary Service Layout (Sheet 2 of 4);  4970-1-GA-262-022, Rev T1 Basement 2 Small Power & Ancillary Service Layout (Sheet 3 of 4); 4970-1-GA-262-023, Rev T1 Basement 2 Small Power & Ancillary Service Layout (Sheet 4 of 4);  4970-A-GA-262-0002, Rev P2 Block A+B Level 1 (Podium) Small Power and Ancillary Services Layout;  4970-C-GA-262-0002, Rev P2 Block C Level 1 (Podium) Small Power and Ancillary Services Layout;  4970-D-GA-262-0002, Rev P2 Block D Level 4 (Podium) Small Power and Ancillary Services Layout;  C0043 L101 - General Arrangement Plan - Ground Floor Public Realm;  Hounslow HSQ - External - REV03 (in three parts). Receive

Condition : 17 - The development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with Barratt London - Planning Condition 9(A) (Waste) Discharge Revision 01 June 2017; Condition 9A Appendix 1 - email exchange with Jessica Sheen of LBH (March 2016); Condition 9A Appendix 2 - email exchange with Pezhman Goudarzi of LBH (May 2017); Condition 9A Appendix 3 - Refuse Strategy Package - TPBennett;  E1108 V 0 298 P2 E1108 V 0 300 A - Received: 12/06/2017.

Condition : 18 - The development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with Barratt London - Planning Condition 18 (Foul and Surface Water) Discharge Revision 01 April 2017; Below Ground Drainage (5089-1-GA-440-0001 & 5089-1-GA-440-002); L15089-DS-SuDs (Drainage strategy & SuDS Report); L15089-MMP (Maintenance and Management Plan); L15089-MD-NTW1, NTW2, NTW3 (MicroDrainage Calculation); L15089-TWSWA (Thames Water Surface Water Flow Approval); L15089-106R (Thames Water 106 response); L15089-TWIS (Thames Water Foul Water Impact Study). Received: 19/04/2017. Flood Risk Assessment Environmental Statement Volume III; Email from Dan Carter (TP Bennett) to Sam Smith (LB Hounslow) dated 18/05/2017 at 09:38am. Received: 18/05/2017, as approved under application 00616/F/P20(18) and maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 19 - The development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with Barratt London - Planning Condition 19 (Residential EVCP) Discharge Revision 01 April 2017; E1108 G 0 098 P22. Received: 19/04/2017. Electric Car Charging (EVC) System Specification. Received: 02/08/2017, as approved under application 00616/F/P20(19) and maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 20 - The development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with Barratt London - Planning Condition 20 (Pubic EVCP) Discharge Revision 01 April 2017; E1108 G 0 099 P23. Received: 19/04/2017. Electric Car Charging (EVC) System Specification. Received: 02/08/2017, as approved under application 00616/F/P20(20) and maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 21 - A. The development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with Barratt London - Planning Condition 15 (Acoustic) Discharge Revision 01 April 2017; 4970-B-GA-250-0008 T2; MVHR - Lo-Carbon Sentinel KineticTC-1157-EL01-PH01 Rev E. Received: 26/04/2017. 01-16-55724 NC12 Rev D - Hounslow HSQ -Discharge of Planning Conditions 15 & 21A Received: 02/10/2017, as approved under application 00616/F/P21(A).
B. Prior to any phase of the development being occupied, sound insulation test reports, demonstrating compliance by that phase with the scheme approved under Part A of this condition, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 22 - A. The development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with Barratt London - Planning Condition 22A (Noise Survey) Discharge Revision 01 June 2017; 01-16-55724 NC13 - Hounslow HSQ - Discharge of Planning Condition 22A - Received: 12/06/2017. 
B. Prior to the occupation of Building C, validation testing shall be carried out to ensure that the rating level described in Part (A) of this condition is not exceeded at Building C and that internal noise levels with windows closed do not exceed a level of 5dB below the BS4142:2014 criteria adopted in the noise chapter, as a result of the operations at the Hounslow Delivery Office.

Condition : 23 - The development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with Barratt London - Planning Condition 23 (Bat Survey) Discharge Revision 01 April 2017; Ecological Management Plan, February 2017 by Greengage Environmental. Received: 12/04/2017. Email from Dan Carter (TP Bennett) to Sam Smith (LB Hounslow) on 17/07/2017 at 14:56, subject RE: High Street Quarter: discharge of conditions, ref: 00616/F/P20. Received: 17/07/2017, as approved under application 00616/F/P20(23) with any recommendations arising from the further survey work shall be implemented prior to occupation of any phase of the development.

Condition : 24 - A). The development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with AECOM Technical Note TN01; Barratt London - Planning Condition 24A (RIBA Plan of Work Stage 3) Discharge Revision 01 April 2017. Received: 19/04/2017, as approved under application 00616/F/P20(24A).
B). No phase of the development shall be occupied until evidence demonstrating that the approved scheme under Part (A) of this condition has been implemented, has been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved design details.

Condition : 25 - Notwithstanding the details contained in the approved Energy Strategy, the development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with Barratt London - Planning Condition 25 (Overheating) Discharge Revision 01 June 2017; CIBSE TM52 Residential Overheating Report revision 2, 8th June 2017; Hounslow High Street Quarter: Communal Corridor Overheating Report Revision 01, 5th June - Received 12/06/2017. Any additional passive measures to minimise overheating recommended from such modelling shall then be implemented prior to occupation of any part of the relevant phase of the development and maintained thereafter.

Condition : 26 - The development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with Barratt London - Planning Condition 26 Discharge Revision 01 May 2018; SG20032 HSQ RMS_cond_disch (confirmation letter from NATS); RMS confirmation email Sam Smith to Chris Cooper 11.05.2018. Received: 31/05/2018, as approved under application 00616/F/P21(26).

Condition : 27 - he development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with Barratt London - Planning Condition 27 (Crane Operation Plan) Discharge Revision 01 April 2017; TC-1157-EL02-PH01 Rev D; TC-1157-EL02-PH02 Rev E; TC-1157-TC4-REF01 Rev A;  Lift Plan April 2017;  Risk Assessment for All Lifting Operations;  Example of Schedule of Common Lifts;  HAL Safeguarding email dated 19.04.2017. Received: 26/04/2017. TC-1157-SCH01-PH01 Rev F; TC-1157-SCH01-PH02 Rev E; TC-1157-EL01-PH01 Rev F; TC-1157-EL01-PH02 Rev D. Received: 02/08/2017, as approved under application 00616/F/P20(27).

Condition : 28 - Prior to the occupation of any residential unit in any phase, details of a scheme of mitigation for exposure to poor air quality internally for each unit of that phase to ensure exposure to air pollution does not exceed national air quality objectives, with regard to 'London Council's Air Quality and Planning Guidance', has been submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The mitigation must then be carried out in accordance with the approved details. The development shall not include biomass boilers.

Condition : 29 - Prior to the first occupation/use of the relevant phase of the development, the parking, loading and turning spaces for that phase shall be constructed and made available for use. The parking, loading and turning spaces shall then be retained as such and shall not be used for any other purposes thereafter.

Condition : 30 - Prior to the occupation of any phase of the development, a means of vehicular access for that phase shall be constructed in accordance with the approved plans and made available for use.

Condition : 31 - Prior to the occupation of the residential units in any phase, the residential cycle storage for that phase shall be made available for use in accordance with the provision indicated on the approved plans, ensuring that all cycle stores shall not accommodate more than 50 stands per store. This storage shall consist of a horizontal storage arrangement to ensure accessibility for all residents. The cycle stores shall then be maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 32 - Prior to the occupation of the commercial units in any phase, the non-residential cycle storage for that phase shall be made available for use in accordance with the provision indicated on the approved plans. This storage shall consist of a horizontal storage arrangement to ensure accessibility for all staff. The cycle stores shall then be maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 33 - Prior to the occupation/use of any phase, details of exterior lighting for that phase shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development of each phase shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved details and shall be retained as such thereafter.

Condition : 34 - Prior to the occupation of any phase of the development, evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of installation contracts) to demonstrate that the development of that phase has been carried out in accordance with the approved Energy Statement, and a reduction in CO2 emissions has been achieved in accordance with the London Plan policies, shall be submitted to and approved in writing, by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 35 - Prior to the occupation of any phase, evidence (schedule of fittings and manufacturers' literature), demonstrating that the development of that phase has been constructed to achieve an internal water consumption of the development not exceeding 105 l/p/day in line with The Water Efficiency Calculator for new dwellings issued by the Department of Communities and Local Government, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 36 - Prior to the occupation of any phase, a Delivery and Servicing Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The Delivery and Servicing Plan shall then be implemented as approved and remain in operation thereafter.

Condition : 37 - Prior to the occupation of any commercial unit within any phase, details of shop front and signage specification for that commercial unit shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The shop front and signage specification shall then be implemented as approved and retained as such thereafter.

Condition : 38 - The development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with Barratt London - Planning Condition 38 Discharge Revision 01 May 2018 4970-1-GA-262-0020, Rev T2 Basement 2 Small Power & Ancillary Services Layout (Sheet 1 of 4); 4970-1-GA-262-0021, Rev T2 Basement 2 Small Power & Ancillary Services Layout (Sheet 2 of 4); 4970-1-GA-262-0022, Rev T2 Basement 2 Small Power & Ancillary Services Layout (Sheet 3 of 4); 4970-1-GA-262-0023, Rev T2 Basement 2 Small Power & Ancillary Services Layout (Sheet 4 of 4); 4970-1-GA-262-0003, Rev T3 Basement 1 Small Power & Ancillary Services Layout (Sheet 1 of 4); 4970-1-GA-262-0004, Rev T3 Basement 1 Small Power & Ancillary Services Layout (Sheet 2 of 4); 4970-1-GA-262-0005, Rev T3 Basement 1 Small Power & Ancillary Services Layout (Sheet 3 of 4); 4970-1-GA-262-0006, Rev T3 Basement 1 Small Power & Ancillary Services Layout (Sheet 4 of 4); 4970-1-GA-262-0007, Rev T2 Ground Floor Small Power & Ancillary Services Layout (Sheet 1 of 5); 4970-1-GA-262-0008, Rev T2 Ground Floor Small Power & Ancillary Services Layout (Sheet 2 of 5); 4970-1-GA-262-0009, Rev T2 Ground Floor Small Power & Ancillary Services Layout (Sheet 3 of 5); 4970-1-GA-262-0010, Rev T2 Ground Floor Small Power & Ancillary Services Layout (Sheet 4 of 5); 4970-1-GA-262-0010, Rev T2 Ground Floor Small Power & Ancillary Services Layout (Sheet 5 of 5); 4970-C-GA-262-0002, Rev T2 Block C Level 1 (Podium) Small Power & Ancillary Services Layout; 4970-A-SC-161-0001, Rev T3 Block A CCTV & Access Control Schematic; 4970-B-SC-161-0001, Rev T3 Block B CCTV & Access Control Schematic; 4970-C-SC-161-0001, Rev T3 Block C CCTV & Access Control Schematic; 4970-D-SC-161-0001, Rev T3 Block D CCTV & Access Control Schematic; CCTV Specifications, received on 04/05/2018 and as approved under application 00616/F/P21(38).

Condition : 39 - Prior to the occupation/use of any ground floor unit of commercial space, full particulars and details of a scheme to insulate the premises against the transmission of airbourne and impact sound shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The relevant part of the development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved scheme and retained as such thereafter. The submission shall include post-completion testing demonstrating that noise levels at the nearest residential receptors will not exceed BS 8233 (good category).

Condition : 40 - No unit within Class A3/A4 use and the cinema (D2 use) shall be occupied/used until a scheme for the control of noise, fumes and odours for that unit, including details of sound attenuation for any necessary plant and a detailed assessment of the effectiveness of the scheme, has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The scheme shall then be implemented as approved before the use of the relevant unit commences and shall be retained as such thereafter.

Condition : 42 - Prior to installation, details (appearance and performance specification) of any external ventilation equipment for any phase, including ducting, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The works shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved details before that phase is first occupied. Plant shall be set in from the roof boundaries by a minimum of 2m.

Condition : 43 - Prior to the completion of the frame of a building in a phase, an Ecological Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The Plan shall incorporate the recommendations of the Phase 1 Habitat Survey included within the Ecology section of the Environmental Statement and details of how the enhancement measures will be monitored, managed and funded in the future. The development of that phase shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved details and retained thereafter.

Condition : 44 - Prior to the completion of the third phase of the development hereby approved, obstacle lights, each a steady state red light with a minimum intensity of 2000 candelas, shall be placed on the tallest structure (the residential tower). Periods of illumination of obstacle lights, obstacle light locations and obstacle light photometric performance must all be in accordance with the requirements of 'CAP168 Licensing of Aerodromes' (available at www.caa.co.uk/srg/aerodrome). The obstacle lights must be maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 45 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8am to 6pm on Mondays to Friday and 8am to 4pm on Saturdays and not at all on Sundays and Public Holidays.

Condition : 46 - The total floorspace areas of the uses hereby approved shall be in accordance with the approved plans. Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Planning Use Classes Order as amended by the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) (Amendment) (England) Order 2005, (or any Order re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no change of use of the flexible A1-5 floorspace to any other use shall be permitted.
Condition : 47 - No additional floorspace shall be formed within the commercial units hereby approved by means of internal horizontal division.
Condition : 48 - All of the residential units hereby approved shall be designed and constructed to comply with the Lifetime Homes Standard.
Condition : 49 - 10% of the residential units hereby approved shall be designed to be wheelchair accessible, or easily adaptable for wheelchair users.

Condition : 50 - No commercial deliveries shall be taken at or dispatched from the site outside the hours of 07.00 hours to 22.00 hours Monday to Saturday nor outside the hours of 09.00 hours to 14.00 hours on Sundays, Bank or Public Holidays.
Condition : 51 - The use of the A1-A5 uses shall not be open to customers outside the hours of 07.00 hours to 24.00 hours.

Condition : 52 - The cinema shall not be open to customers outside the hours of 06.00 hours to 02.00 hours Sunday-Thursday and 06.00 hours to 03.30 hours Friday, Saturday and Sundays before Bank Holidays.
Condition : 53 - No amplified or other music played in or from the Class A3/A4 or D2 uses shall be audible outside of the premises.

Condition : 54 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any Order revoking and re-enactlng that Order with or without modification), no aerials or satellite dishes shall be erected on any buildings of the development hereby approved.

Condition : 55 - No development shall take place on any phase until full details (including drawings) of the following, relevant to that phase, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority:

a) The location of the gates to each service yard, including the means by which they are opened and closed. No infrastructure should be placed on the public highway.
b) Safe pedestrian routes between the disabled parking spaces and lifts within the basement car park.

c) The residential cycle stores within the residential basement car park.

Condition : 56 - Prior to the occupation/use of any phase, full details (including drawings) showing the location of the car club spaces in the basement car park which have been agreed with the car club operator, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority that show the location of the car club spaces in the basement car park which have been agreed with the car club operator.
Condition : 57 - The development hereby approved shall not exceed 588 dwellings (348 private, 165 shared ownership and 75 affordable rent).

Condition : 58 - The total floorspace areas of the uses hereby approved shall be limited to the following: (i) Multi-screen Cinema (Use Class D2): 6,408 sqm (GEA) (ii) Commercial Floorspace (Flexible Use Classes A1, A2, A3, A4 & A5): 8,897 sqm (GEA) and (iii) Office (Use Class B1a): 1,214sqm (GEA).
